website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line acoustic guitar bag that will maintain its quality for years to come.
pros: Internal foam padding offers supreme protection of your guitar's headstock, neck and body
Removable color-matched backpack straps are sleek and versatile
cons: Handle, seams and strap adjusters sometimes break, even after limited use

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this in August and in January the back ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this in August and in January the back pack straps were showing signs of separating from the bag. Now we are on the hunt for a new bag because of the risk of failure. Update... in less than a year the handle has separated from the case and the back pack straps are tearing from the case..
customer_reviews.author: J. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Decent company, HORRIBLE design...
customer_reviews.text: Worst "travel" guitar case I've ever handled... I brought it with me on a mini tour to Europe, and even through not much carrying, the seams RIPPED completely off down the back side and the side carrying handle. Everything else about the case was alright... But for the amount I spent? A complete and TOTAL rip off. It's a shame.. because Gator's other products are alright. But this was a disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Danny Huergo

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself the favor of jumping into this price bracket if your lookimg for a gig bag. The quality far outshines the budget bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gig bag for the price. I'm able to fit my Strat, Ibanez 6 & 7 string. The padding is more than sufficient with removable Velcro pieces for the head stovk , neck rest, and base. Making me think this case will fit most guitars. All my personal equipment fits including my tools laptop i-rig cables strings and even my foldable stand. If you need more room they have attached sturdy metal rings to attach other storage. The materiel is thick and feels very durable. And the zippers seem the same. Honestly the bag functions and feels great to carry along with looking even better than it does in the photo.
customer_reviews.author: Proponent

customer_reviews.title: Nice case. Bought it for my 14 yo son
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. Bought it for my 14 yo son. One of the straps broke on its very first use. Bummer. I see it has for others as well. We'd have given it a much higher rating has it held up at all. Amazon return process remains fairly painless, thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfection at a perfect price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the Cadillac of gig cases! The Ovation CS24P-FKOA Acoustic-Electric Guitar, fits in it like it was made for it, It is semi rigid, and I would not be afraid if it happened to be tossed around a little bit, like at the airport or someplace similar, The backpack style is comfortable and well constructed at stress points. Very happy with this purchase. And you can't beat this price!
customer_reviews.author: Wiscogal

customer_reviews.title: Great case in all ways but one
customer_reviews.text: Great case in all ways but one: The STRAP ADJUSTERS ARE TINY AND MADE OF JUNK PLASTIC. The entire guitar is being held on your back by two, maybe 1/8" plastic strips on the strap adjusters. One of mine broke--I don't even know how--and the guitar, which I was wearing by one strap at the time, fell.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Hua

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice case/bag. It is much sturdier than a basic gig bag. The padding is nice and thick. It's much more rigid than a bag. Interior has a really soft lining and several adjustable pads to allow customization for your guitar. Fabrick is nice quality and looks amazing. The zippers all run smoothly and have cord/rubber pulls on them. The pockets are well designed and thought out. Overall quality is fantastic and looks are on point. There's no doubt it offers better protection than gig bag but is softer and easier to haul around than a hard case. I couldn't be happier or more impressed with the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Monte

customer_reviews.title: Well made, Light, Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My guitar came with a heavy duty case designed, I think, so one could dance upon it. Taking the guitar to lessons was onerous to say the least. It was TOO heavy. This case is delightful. It carries ALL the music I need as well as my glasses, picks, capo, etc. It's sturdy. The interior is well padded and my guitar fits perfectly, It looks GREAT. And, best of all---it's light! I can easily transport my guitar without worrying that it will be damaged and without worrying that my back will go out lugging its old case.
customer_reviews.author: TouchingPaws

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Bag
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly I have only had this gear bag for a short while, but I’m impressed with the quality and overall design of this bag. It is an excellent choice for those looking for a semi-soft bag at a reasonable price. I have taken notice of the reviews that have experienced rips, but after receiving the bag and observing the quality of the construction, it is hard to imagine that happing with normal handling. For now, I'm satisfied this bag will protect my tenor ukulele for what I require as a non-professional player.
customer_reviews.author: W David Astor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case, quality build - with one glaring flaw.
customer_reviews.text: The case material is sturdy, the construction quality is excellent. This is a great case and a great value. It'd be five stars, easily. But. Whomever at the company decided to be "innovative" and put this ridiculous hook thing, in place of a standard locking plastic buckle needs to be fired. Closing the flap securely over the zippered enclosure is an exercise in futility. It's loose and doesn't secure anything other than frustration. It just falls open. There's no way to make this thing latch securely. It flops open as you're carrying the case and offers no security whatsoever. What a STUPID idea.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Schoonover

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the red velvet inside, very classy. My main complaint is there is no solid black color, the darkest they have is more like a grayish charcoal, not the end of the world but I do prefer black black. The front pocket is also fairly large and sticks out a good bit, would be nice if it were detachable or something but hardly a deal breaker. If you're looking for a stylish case with solid protection, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I actually paid more for the case ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I actually paid more for the case than the guitar that's usually in it, but I wanted a good travel case. It's big enough that when I put my concert body Martin in it I can pack a day or two of clothing around the guitar, eliminating the need for carrying another suitcase! Carries well. Materials are quality and all flaps and zippers work great and seem to be holding up. Sizing: - Fits my Yamaha full size dreadnought PERFECTLY - Fits my Martin SWOMGT (concert body) loosely. Needs stuff packed around it to keep it still.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse McCandless

customer_reviews.title: Gator Transit-Series Gig Bag Provides Complete Protection for Your Instrument
customer_reviews.text: My Gator Transit-Series gig bag is the best and most convenient guitar protection I have ever had! Besides being lightweight and waterproof, it is well-cushioned and adaptable to almost any size guitar you store in it. This is due to attachable cushions inside the gig bag that prevent smaller guitars from bouncing around while being moved. I would highly recommend Gator Transit-Series gig bags over hardshell cases any day. That is why I own six of them (for six guitars)!
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Crepeau

customer_reviews.title: Thick padding. Excellent construction. Fits my bass perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second GATOR case I have purchased. Based on my experience with the first, I purchased this case to haul around a Hagstrom 8-string bass re-issue. As I expected, I found the case to be of excellent materials and construction. The padding is thick and sturdy, but not bulky. The case included velcro attachable padded inserts that allows you to customize the fit of the case to your particular instrument. This was important to me since my bass was short scale, and it allowed me to fit the case to the bass. I would not hesitate to purchase another GATOR case in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus49

customer_reviews.title: Gator Transit Gig Bag
customer_reviews.text: Received this gig bag today and I am very satisfied. It's attractive, well made and adequately protects the instrument. Perfect for my needs. Of course, I am not going to gig with it or strap it to my back, I'll take it on road trips but that's about it. I'm sure it will work well for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Allan J

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is nice and there are plenty of pockets to tote accessories
customer_reviews.text: I felt a bit nervous spending this much money on a case, but if you are going to spend money on a bass, you might as well invest in some protection. This case exceeds my expectations. The build quality is nice and there are plenty of pockets to tote accessories. The padded shoulder straps and carrying handle are comfortable and resilient. I would recommend to pretty much anyone, especially people that spend a good deal of time walking with their bass.
customer_reviews.author: JTStockwell

customer_reviews.title: Well padded and durable
customer_reviews.text: This case was exactly what I was looking for to travel with my electric guitar. As with all cases I have been told not to trust the plastic connectors on the straps, so preemptively reinforcing with zip ties. Just seemed like a good idea. I would buy this case again.
customer_reviews.author: Chjava

customer_reviews.title: Good gig bag
customer_reviews.text: Well made, heavy duty across the board (zippers, seams, etc). Good functionality such as the versatile carrying options (back straps versus handles), the well placed pockets, and the adjustable big pocket can hold a lot of stuff (strap, music book, etc). Good padding and headstock/neck support inside as well, providing good protection of your guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rabiner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect case for traveling gigs!!
customer_reviews.text: This case is perfect!! I’m a traveling music therapist, and love that the case is lightweight, sturdy, and has nice reinforcements such as the rubber on the bottom and flexible zipper pulls. The pockets are slim but ample for my needs, and the backpack straps are comfy and balanced. It’s also got wonderful design elements; the red interior is a nice touch!
customer_reviews.author: Alison D.

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar case
customer_reviews.text: This case fits our full-size acoustic guitar perfectly. It is a nice compromise from a floppy case and a hard case. It is light, yet very padded and keeps the guitar well protected. It has plenty of extra pocket space for tuners, picks, extra strings etc. The big pocket is perfect for keeping music books in. Zippers slide easily. I think this case will last a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gig Bag
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent light duty gig bag. It will protect your guitar from light bumps and small drops (if you're looking for an inexpensive substitute for a real hard case, gig bags are not your solution). It's well padded and the fabric is quite durable. The padding is adjustable so it fits a variety of guitars, something I find quite useful. There are cheaper bags out there, but probably not as good a quality.
customer_reviews.author: Schmedley

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag - my Strat fits perfectly and it's held up nicely!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first Gator Transit last year, been using it back and forth to practice and it's been a dream. With the guitar on my back I can carry all of my gear in 1 go. The case itself is sturdy, protects my guitar perfectly, and the pockets fit everything I need to bring along (extra strings, cables, etc). So, just purchased a 2nd one for my Danelectro.
customer_reviews.author: M. Betti

customer_reviews.title: Straps are weak link but replaceable.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice looking case, the padding is prodigious and it’s comfortable. My concerns lie with the straps. At first glance I thought they did everything right except for the cheap plastic clips ... weakest link not a mystery. The buckles are cheap to and you will have to constantly adjust as they skip down to max length a lot. My guitars are blissfully happy though
customer_reviews.author: derek domino

customer_reviews.title: This Gator case is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This case for my husband's electric bass is so much nicer than we could have imagined! The quality is excellent!! His beloved bass is well protected, and the large pocket on the front is very convenient. It's easy to carry, and the straps allow for hands-free use. I highly recommend this case!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Solid gig bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a protective gig bag with nice padding and good support for the guitar neck, and with extra padding to fit concert size guitars. I would recommend this bag, and I would buy it again, but improvements would include: 1. Metal hardware instead of plastic for the straps . 2. Concert sized version. (Although with the provided extra padding, a concert sized guitar fits well. ) 3. Better balance for carrying with one strap on a single shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd F.

customer_reviews.title: Well made.  Fairly expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Nice exterior color, strong fabric, 2 main zippers with pull strings, secure carry handle, strong straps for back carry, adequate pocket for music and one small one for other items, bright red fleece interior with removable end supports (Velcro attached) if you need more room for your guitar(my full size acoustic fits fine). I was tempted to buy the less expensive one since I'm still learning to play but I'm glad I bought this one. 4
customer_reviews.author: John Grosso

customer_reviews.title: Fits a large electric bass
customer_reviews.text: This case is more protective than expected. The padding is thick, and the case feels very solid and sturdy. We had a hard time finding a case for my husband's Conklin electric bass, so we are very happy with this one. The padded inserts are also removable/adjustable to suit your needs.
customer_reviews.author: SAH87

customer_reviews.title: works awesome
customer_reviews.text: great bag and well designed. the extra thick padding keeps the guitar safe and has the handles and straps where they are needed. even the flap to protect the outer pocket is neat because it hides the zipper of that pocket. i wish the pocket at the top was bigger...... (i put my capo and tuners and spare batteries in there). it's 50 bucks more at guitar center too...
customer_reviews.author: bass kid

customer_reviews.title: Better Protection
customer_reviews.text: The case has more cushioning than most others. Straps and handle are sturdy, the zippers barbar tied for easier opening & closing. The storage compartments are sufficient, but would like to see a small 2nd pouch compartment instead of a flat one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Nice Case!  Well Made, Well thought out, and attractive too.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really, really nice case. It fits both my 12 String (Epiphone) guitar and my son's Acoustic Resonator Bass (Regal). It is high quality manufacture, very light weight and well thought out - and it looks good too! I am sure we are going to get many miles and years out of this case and our instruments will be safe and sound all throughout.
customer_reviews.author: R. Otten

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and durable constuction
customer_reviews.text: I was a little concerned with some negative reviews from some buyers. The bag looks great, is light weight but very stout and very well padded. It holds my Martin HD-28 well and is ok for day to day gig carry. I wouldn't ship it with the guitar inside, as I would with the original Martin hard shell that weighs a ton and is nearly indestructible, but if your reasonably careful this bag is great so far. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: vltho

customer_reviews.title: Light but super strong and very plush inside
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a beast! Very durable but super plush inside and very sturdy protection. Feel 100% confident in it's ability to protect a $1000+ electric guitar.
customer_reviews.author: John Farrar

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a super excellent gig bag. It has removable pads to make it fit just about any acoustic. My only complaint would be the "e" shaped hook on the front of the bag, which slides over & holds down the front flap. Unless it it stretched to the max, to go into the slot it can come undone & therefore insecure. But, all in all, it's a great gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Ray DeFoe

customer_reviews.title: fantastic protection for a gig bag
customer_reviews.text: very well-made case, very thoughtfully designed. It feels very rugged and, short of a significant crushing force, I feel confident it will protect my guitar in almost every other situation. This makes it heavier and a bit bigger than a normal gig bag, still much lighter and more portable than a hard case.
customer_reviews.author: E. A Young

customer_reviews.title: Gator Guitar soft case
customer_reviews.text: The bag is nice to use for short trips. It is "hard" enough to protect the guitar. I love the extra accessories. Recommend to use for short gigs. Buy the hard shell for longer road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Leala Jew

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, supportive case
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful case from Gator cases. It has great support for the neck, the padding all around the guitar is great, and it has a LOT of pockets and places to stash stuff. It also have great, adjustable backpack type straps for a comfortable carry. Overall? This is about a good a gig bag as you can get without getting a hard case. I'd recommend it 100%, and it is definitely worth the extra money than some of the other lower priced gig bags out there.
customer_reviews.author: celtic_matthew

customer_reviews.title: Really great gig bag
customer_reviews.text: I _really_ like this case. I was skeptical at first due to its price, but it's well worth it. The padding is nice and thick, and the compartments are big enough to hold all of my stuff - 3 cables, zoom b3 and power cord, headphones, snark tuner, and extra strings. If I crushed certain things I could also fit a collapsible stand in there. I've used it with a Schecter Stargazer, Ibanez SR305, and Fender Jazz bass. So far it's been used at 4 shows and a bunch of practices.
customer_reviews.author: paranoid

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: This is really well made and attractive looking. It fits my Seagull acustic guitar like a glove and I would feel pretty confident taking this through the airport without damaging the guitar. I really like the "backpack straps" for easy, casual carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but bass size?
customer_reviews.text: A well made gig bag with lots of padding but I think it is made for short scale bass rather than standard scale-length bass. My Squier Precision bass wouldn't fit. But no matter I have guitars that need a better gig bag and this is a nice one.
customer_reviews.author: Tony King

customer_reviews.title: Atteactive, light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a hollow body Ibanez even though it's made for acoustic. Fits great and sturdier than I thought. Going to get another one specifically for my AF55 and move my acoustic to this. Really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Durable material and as described
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for spouse to keep guitar in good condition. Case was as described. Durable material and stitching. Been used for about a year and still looks brand new. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Fenders
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fender Stratacoustic and wanted a hardshell case. I could not find one that I felt great about, so I started looking for gig bags. In a nutshell, this gig bag is an absolutely perfect fit. It looks great, too. I am 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Spazmatic Guitar Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Elegant, spacious, lightweight and well built. It fit my beloved classical guitar like a glove. I love it and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: RAMON ROMAN

customer_reviews.title: Very well designed case with excellent protection for the guitar
customer_reviews.text: Very well designed case with excellent protection for the guitar. A little bit of moisture got into the case when I was caught in a downpour, but otherwise weather resistant. Basically loved that it wasn't BLACK!! Enough already with black!! Particularly like that pockets are slanted for easy access and has a grab handle on the back. A good deal overall.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken picker

customer_reviews.title: It feels like it will protect my instruments well.
customer_reviews.text: I have been playing and teaching bass for over 50 years. I have worn out many, many gig bags. This Gator Case is outstanding. It is stylish, just the right size for my basses, and seems well built. All the handles and pockets are in just the right places. It feels like it will protect my instruments well. The moveable pads inside are a bonus. I look forward to giving it a thorough workout in the very near future. If it lasts a decent amount of time with heavy use, this is a helluva value! Jim Stinnett
customer_reviews.author: Bookspecksmom

customer_reviews.title: Room for every thing.
customer_reviews.text: Just the guitar in the main case. Accessories pouches for strings and tuner. Big covered pocket will fit a three ring binder for music.
customer_reviews.author: BENJAMIN CARTER-ALLEN

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Gator Products Rock and this case is no exception. Fits my Strat and Tele like it was made for it (which, come to think of it. . .) Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: dbx820

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding protection and a gorgeous design
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding protection and a gorgeous design. It's just missing a handle on the front around the 12th fret but you can add it yourself because of all the metal loops. I'll be buying gator for a very long time. I just wish the zippers were as good as Roadrunner but gator wins on both style and protection. Beautiful cases for sure.
customer_reviews.author: T. Holl

customer_reviews.title: great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: excellent product. well made good quality. well padded, keeps instrument safe and secure. love the pocket choices and location. great for sheet music, picks, and extra strings.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case, I was looking for something with a bit more protection than my gig bag but shy of a full hard case. This is it, nice foam throughout and exterior fabric is very durable. If I were to change anything it would be the locking on the flap for the storage and change it to a snap lock.
customer_reviews.author: william springer

customer_reviews.title: Real nice gig bag and looks great too.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected and hoped it would be. A nice gig bag. Would buy again. I think the nicer gig bags cost more than they should but in this situation I needed a case that would be lighter and less bulky than a Fender tolex strat case or the big plastic molded cases and I like this bag fine.
customer_reviews.author: C L Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Super super quality.  Love love love.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in black and in tan. Beautiful. Super great quality. Fits multiple sizes of guitars because it’s adjustable. Beautiful soft red lining inside. Great pockets on the outside fit a big binder of music or multiple books etc, also space for capos..tuners etc.
customer_reviews.author: BusyBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Gibson LP Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my primary gig bag for my Les Paul so that my hands stay free to wheel an amp cart. It's well made, protects the instrument, is easy to open/close, and looks nice. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: G. Simon

customer_reviews.title: This is a great rugged case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rugged case, lots of padding. I love it because it is very low profile, the straps are high quality. I use it for my G&L legacy tribute. I use it to bring back and forth to gigs. I never thought I would like the back pack on a case, but it allows me to grab more gear in less trips.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Might Even be BETTER than a Hardshell Case!
customer_reviews.text: Great padding, and the pockets are well placed and roomy. I bought this for a backup guitar to take to gigs. I have a hardshell case for my other. But, frankly, I use this one instead of the hardshell because of the great padding and the the light weight. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar case
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, very attractive with plenty of pockets for everything my son needs to take to his lessons. Sturdy and durable works like a hard case with a lot of protective padding.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W.

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with this case
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this case. The outer material seems very durable. I didn't want a hard case but did want more protection and padding than most gig bags I've seen. I think the price is great for the quality - which is also excellent.
customer_reviews.author: oldscoop

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag.
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and is well made. Well padded without being heavy. Shoulder straps are padded which is nice. I'm using it for my Sire M2 5 string. Enough pockets for a small stand, cable, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Estamazon

customer_reviews.title: Expectations met.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic padded gig bag! Obviously not a tank of a hard case like the one that protects my 1973 Guild F40 blg, but best soft case I’ve ever seen/had. The inside is nicer than the mini Taylor bag, and the Taylor is not too shabby. It could have more pockets for other stuff, but over all it makes a good first impression. Time and miles will tell the story and I am dragging it to Europe for the next couple of weeks and will report any issues.
customer_reviews.author: James O. Young. Jr.

customer_reviews.title: It's "Just right" - This one is the one you want.
customer_reviews.text: Just enough protection for walking around and riding in the car. Holds a few extras too. Holds everything thing I have- Les Paul , Tele, PRS 594 and my EJ Strat. Much lighter than a hard case and won't ding up the car if you bump it! :D I'm thinking about buying a second. :).
customer_reviews.author: Chris in the Mojave

customer_reviews.title: Good Protection both out and indoors
customer_reviews.text: If your serious about your instrument and you will be carrying it back and forth, I recommend this as I use it once a week to go to my class.. Even when at the house it’s inside when the instrument is not being used because as you know accidents do happen.. provides added security for peace of mind..
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Husband is Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my musician husband. He is VERY picky and loved this gig bag to carry his electric guitar in. Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: nmshopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Construction, durability and usefulness are unmatched!
customer_reviews.text: Best gig bag ever. This bag is so well constructed, I use it as a regular case for my flamenco guitar. Holds firm, soft, non-marking inside. More useful pockets than any other bag I've had.
customer_reviews.author: M. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great case, wish it was a bit longer
customer_reviews.text: The case is wonderful in terms of quality. One issue we had is that the case was 1-2" too short for the particular base we have.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Good gigging
customer_reviews.text: Great gig bag I like the moving padding to protect a specific instrument
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping....good...!makes me confident.!!!
customer_reviews.text: Fender Bass Guitar fits nicely in size .. Nice appearance ... makes me confident.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best soft case I own. I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Norman

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar case
customer_reviews.text: Overall I have no complaints. Is a great guitar case. I have an eight sting guitar so the neck is wider and the whole guitar is a bit longer. I removed the extra pads at the top and bottom and fit perfectly. As for as looks, I love it. Looks very nice, the pictures don't quite do it justice.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Great Case.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: very protecting, well made, comfortable to carry. Cons: the accessory pockets are limiting to what you can, conveniently, take with you.
customer_reviews.author: R A M in Vancouver

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it’s big and awkward to carry and all the foam just feels kind of flimsy and like it won’t hold up for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jami L.

customer_reviews.title: Great case with plenty of padding to keep my guitar safe!
customer_reviews.text: Great case with plenty of padding to keep my Larrivee safe while gigging! Much lighter than my hardshell case. The backpack straps aren't always needed but come in very handy when carrying other gear in each hand! The only downsides are that there isn't anything to hold the backpack straps down against the case when they are not in use and that the chrome buckle on the front easily comes detached from the loop if the case is turned over the wrong way. Luckily as long as the zipper is shut nothing falls out of the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Biggie Fries

customer_reviews.title: Well made case
customer_reviews.text: Well made bag, lots of compartments for extra things ... capo, picks, strings, etc. It can be worn like a backpack, which i never do, but maybe if I biked with it? Before I bought this I was thinking of buying a hardshell case, but the internet seemed to think my guitar would be an inch or two too long for everything. It fits comfortably in this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas-Patel

customer_reviews.title: My Takamine was asking for a new ride!
customer_reviews.text: Wow Gorgeous, I purchased this case for my Takamine LTD. Because she's worth it! by far the nicest and most protective case this guitar has ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

I only need to walk with this one bag, depending on the amount of effects I’m using. It’s still worth the money for the security it provides alone.

product_meta.title: Gator Cases Transit Series Acoustic Guitar Gig Bag; Grey Exterior (GT-ACOUSTIC-GRY)
product_meta.description: Color:Grey| Style:AcousticGator's TRANSIT series acoustic guitar gig bag provides rugged case-like protection without sacrificing the lightweight portability of a gig bag. The adaptable interior safeguards your guitar with rigid 200mm thick foam padding with a plush red micro-fleece lining and features a three-point padding system to protect at the headstock, neck, and bottom/endpin. The weather resistant exterior comes in charcoal black, Light Grey and tan. A thick rubber treading on the bottom of the bag prevents wear while shielding from the elements. A unique storage system features a large zippered pocket for accessories and the g-hook buckle and seatbelt loops provide multiple connection points allowing you to fill the pocket and still close with ease. A small zippered pocket on the front provides additional storage. The TRANSIT series acoustic guitar gig bag fits most standard Dreadnaught acoustic guitars. Please refer to internal Dims for an exact fit.
feature_bullets: Weather resistant blended fabric exterior with thick rubber Tread on bottom of the Bag prevents wear
20mm thick internal foam padding covered with plush Micro-Fleece lining and adjustable, removable Three-Point interior padding system protects the headstock, neck and Body
Large front zippered pocket with flap, features G-Hook Buckle and Seatbelt loops for multiple Con-nection points allowing you to fill the pocket to capacity and still secure it
Padded comfort grip carry handle and removable, color matched backpack straps
Interior Dims: Body Length: 21" Body height: 6" lower bout width: 16.5" middle bout width: 13" upper bout width: 13" overall Length 44".

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars488 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
